meanings.definition: To give up or surrender control or possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to cede his throne to his son.
meanings.sent2: The company had to cede some of its profits to pay off debts.
meanings.sent3: The cat refused to cede its favorite spot on the couch to the new puppy.
meanings.sent4: After a long debate, the team finally agreed to cede victory to their opponents.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to cede control of the classroom to the substitute for the day.

meanings.definition: To transfer or yield something, such as territory or rights, to another party.
meanings.sent1: The country decided to cede a small piece of land to its neighbor.
meanings.sent2: The artist had to cede the rights to his artwork to the gallery for display.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully argued over who would cede the last cookie to the other.
meanings.sent4: The captain made the difficult decision to cede command of the ship to his first mate.
meanings.sent5: The farmer had to cede some of his land to the government for a new road construction project.
